title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 1. The Approved Qualifications for Social Workers Bye-Law 2021 (S.I.
text_raw:
1. The Approved Qualifications for Social Workers Bye-Law 2021 (S.I. 
259 of 2021) is hereby revoked with effect from the date specified in paragraph 
(2.(2)), without prejudice to any applications for registration or restoration 
received by the board prior to that date.
text_norm: 1 approved qualification social worker bye-law 2021 (s.i 259 2021) hereby revoked effect date specified paragraph (2.(2)) without prejudice application registration restoration received board prior date

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 2. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Approved Qualifications for Social
text_raw:
2. (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Approved Qualifications for Social 

Workers Bye-Law 2022. 

(2) The bye-law comes into operation on 29th June 2022.
text_norm: 2 (1) bye-law may cited approved qualification social worker bye-law 2022 (2) bye-law come operation 29th june 2022

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: In the bye-law –
text_raw:
3. 

In the bye-law – 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (no.27 of 
2005) (as amended from time to time); 

“the Register” means the register of the Social Workers Registration Board 
established under section 36(1)(a) of the Act.
text_norm: 3 bye-law - act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no.27 2005) (as amended time time) register mean register social worker registration board established section 36(1)(a) act

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 4. The Social Workers Registration Board, for the purposes of Section
text_raw:
4. The Social Workers Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 
38(2)(a) of the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to 
the standard of proficiency required for registration in the Register: 

(1) Master of Social Work, University College Cork; 

(2) Postgraduate Diploma in Social Work Studies, University College 

Cork; 

(3) Masters of Social Science (Social Work), National University of 

Ireland, University College Dublin; 

(4) Graduate Diploma in Social Work, National University of Ireland, 

University College Dublin 

(5) Masters in Social Work, University of Dublin, Trinity College; 

(6) Postgraduate Diploma in Social Work, University of Dublin, Trinity 

College; 

(7) Masters in Social Work, National University of Ireland, Galway; 

(8) Bachelor of Social Work, University College Cork; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st July, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [311] 3

(9) Bachelor in Social Studies, University of Dublin, Trinity College

(10) Master of Arts in Social Work, Institute of Technology Sligo

(11) Masters in Science (Social Work), National University of Ireland,

University College Dublin; 

(12) Professional Master of Social Work, National University of Ireland,

University College Dublin. 

(13) Master of Social Science (Social Work), National University of Ireland,

Maynooth 

(14) Postgraduate Diploma in Social Work, National University of Ireland,

Maynooth 

(15) Master of Arts in Social Work, Atlantic Technological University

The Minister for Health approves the making of this bye-law. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Health, 

21 June, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Social Workers Registration Board 
 29 June 2022 

MARIE KENNEDY, 

 Chairperson, Social Workers Registration Board 

JOHN HANILY, 

 Member, Social Workers Registration Board. 

 4 [311]

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law identifies the qualifications awarded in the State which are 
approved by the Social Workers Registration Board as attesting to the standard 
of proficiency required for registration with the Social Workers Registration 
Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [311] 5
